hypothesis_content.title: Regime Transition Momentum Fade on Failed Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC attempts a regime transition from NEUTRAL to BULL but fails to sustain above the 20-day ATR-adjusted resistance band (price + 1.5*ATR) for 48 hours, a mean reversion back into NEUTRAL regime occurs with 68% probability within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed regime transitions often create 'bull traps' where early momentum buyers capitulate. The combination of overbought RSI with failed technical breakout creates optimal mean reversion setup during NEUTRAL regimes where trend persistence is low.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above 20-day SMA + 1.5*20-day ATR (bullish transition signal)
Price fails to close above this level for 2 consecutive days
Regime indicator shows NEUTRAL → BULL transition attempt
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such failed breakout attempts lead to immediate continuation above resistance within 3 days
